channel.title: Coder on EdAnisko.com
channel.description: Recent content in Coder on EdAnisko.com

item.title: Shortcuts
item.description: This page is for links and snippets that I use regularly enough that I need a place for them. Hugo Build Command $ rm -rf /docs && HUGO_ENV=production hugo -d docs --minify AWS SSO Login https://edanisko.awsapps.com/login/

item.title: DynamoDB - What You Need to Know
item.description: DynamoDB lets you scale indefinately while maintaining single digit millisecond response times. If you need to read that again go ahead but I’ll break it down again. With DynamoDB you can store as much structured data as you like. Your queries will always return lighting fast. If that sounds different that what you data team has been telling you, send them a link to this post.

item.title: Quasar Queries
item.description:
Adding alpaca api to a node project so I can buy a share of QQQ or AAPL.

Its easy enough to use the alpaca CLI in a flat js file. Next step is to add it to an application, add a few buttons and so on.

item.title: Laravel Nova - Big Filter Menu
item.description: Laravel Nova is a great way to get an admin panel up and running. If you built your project with Laravel, Nova will fit right on top. You can create resources based on your models. The resources have all sorts of fields so you can display

item.title: Laravel Permissions - Working with Roles
item.description:
Install the Package

Laravel has a way of authorizing a user to act on an object. Please read the docs if you like. You will start off writing Gates. Gates allow and deny access to actions. You can define Gate

item.title: Contact
item.description: Send me a note if you like. This form uses Formspree, a simple, free form service. Your Name Email Address An email address is required. Message
